com.generalnegentropics.archis.utils
Class MathExpression

java.lang.Object
  com.generalnegentropics.archis.utils.MathExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class MathExpression
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable

Math Expression

This class implements a mathematical expression evaluator that allows expressions consisting of simple variables, numbers, and operators to be evaluated. When instantiated it precompiles the expression and then can be executed repeatedly for different sets of variables. It is an immutable class like String and Number so it can be shared and used from multiple threads. The evaluate method is thread safe.

This parser is fully conscious of the order of operations: parentheses, exponents, multiplication, division, addition, subtraction.

Allowed operators are: +, -, *, /, and ^ (anything else will be considered part of a variable name).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Adam Ierymenko
See Also:

evaluate

public double evaluate(java.util.Map variables)
                throws MathExpressionException,
                       java.lang.ArithmeticException

Evaluates a math expression

This evaluates this MathExpression for a given specific set of variables. The variables map can contain either Number objects or String objects. If it contains String objects the strings will be parsed into numeric values. Anything else or an invalid numeric string will evaluate to 0.

Parameters:
variables - Map containing variable values
Returns:
double Result of evaluation
Throws:
MathExpressionException - Math expression was not valid
java.lang.ArithmeticException - An arithmatic error (e.g. division by zero) occurred
